My history teacher suggested Chamberlain held back the war while we made (albeit inadequate) preparations. Eden was badly advised and incompetent.
Blair was just inept... and used his greedy chancellor to debt fuel popularity purchasing measures.
I can find no good word for Callaghan.Â He was mindbendingly incompetent and out of touch.Â Like Brown he was a Chancellor who moved to PM.. That seems Always to have been a recipe for bad government.
I think these three tie for second place.Â I vote for ryeatley's choice: Heath.Â This treasonous weasel caused virtually every ill that has beset us since.Â Sometimes he caused the problems simply because he invoked such a sense of hatred amongst his colleagues and opponents they would set out to spite him.
On November 5th we should Burn effigies of all four though.
